results.title: Appearances can deceive: offenders with intellectual disabilities
results.creator_credit: Suzanne Baker, Suzanne Baker Productions, New South Wales. Premier's Dept. Disability Services Co-ordination Unit, New South Wales Film Corporation and Bob Kingsbury
results.brief_description: Designed to improve awareness of intellectually disabled offenders in the criminal justice system, given that this group comprise a disproportionate percentage of both the prison population and juvenile offenders held in institutions. Re-enacts a shop lifting offence by an intellectually disabled youth and follows the case from initial apprehension by the store detective and police interviewing to the arrest and court proceedings. Emphasises the importance of liason with community agencies.
results.title_for_label: Appearances can deceive: offenders with intellectual disabilities
results.creator_credit_for_label: Suzanne Baker, Suzanne Baker Productions, New South Wales. Premier’s Dept. Disability Services Co-ordination Unit, New South Wales Film Corporation and Bob Kingsbury

results.title: Images of the land: 100 years of Australian landscapes
results.creator_credit: Queensland Film Corporation and Ian Stocks
results.brief_description: Highlights the work of some of Australia’s most important artists from the 19th century to the present time. Includes the works of Arthur Streeton, Hans Heysen, Russell Drysdale, Sidney Nolan, Fred Williams and others who present us with their visions of the Australian landscape.

results.title: The great dinosaur hunt
results.creator_credit: Reel Images, Location Equipment and Brian Beaton
results.brief_description: Western Australia is one of the oldest areas in the world and contains the earliest fossilised evidence of life walking on earth. This video follows Australian palaeontologist, Dr John Long, and the Dinosaur Club of the Museum of Western Australia (which includes hundreds of children) on their hunt for fossils, bones and footprints of the dinosaurs who once lived in that state. Computer and model animation are used to illustrate the dinosaurs whose relics have been unearthed, some of which are unknown in the Northern Hemisphere, which possibly suggests Australia was the last home of the dinosaurs before their extinction.

results.title: Life in the Desert
results.brief_description: The viewer is taken into the Australian desert and shown the amazing variety of plants and animals and informed how they manage to survive in such extreme conditions.

results.title: Cold comfort: Australia's nuclear responsibilities
results.creator_credit: Open Channel Productions and Jack White
results.brief_description: Cold Comfort is a lively and incisive documentary on the local and global consequences of the decision to export Australian uranium. It presents statements by those who support the mining of uranium for nuclear energy purposes, alongside those who oppose it. The program incorporates archival footage, and contemporary interviews to chart Australia’s participation in atomic history. Presented in four sequences. “The Uranium debate”, “The History of the bomb”, “Transportation of radioactive waste” and “Fallout from Chernobyl and Three Mile Island”.

results.title: Banjo's Australia
results.brief_description: This program explains A. B. Paterson’s contribution and significance to Australian literature from the 1890’s to the World War I. It traces Paterson’s personal history, his love of the bush, his admiration for camaraderie and spirit of the bush and the pathos and humour of bush life.

results.title: Wildlife of the River Valley
results.brief_description: A program that presents a unique view of the enormous variety of wildlife that lives in the Bellinger River Valley, situated halfway between Sydney and Brisbane on the east coast of Australia. This is a brightly paced, entertaining and informative documentary that can be enjoyed by audiences of all ages.

results.title: MIMA Yearbook. Vol. 2
results.brief_description: Volume two of a three volume set, this video compilation of excerpts of Australian film and video art covers the period from 1980-1983, and is a unique and tantalising entry into non-mainstream history of Australian film and video.

results.title: Image makers (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Ursula Kolbe and Institute of Early Childhood Studies (Waverley, N.S.W.)
results.brief_description:
Looks at the way children make images and how this helps them explore and cope with the world at large, giving it order and meaning.

Includes footage from the Murawina Aboriginal Education Centre in Redfern, Sydney.
